ygData.subject: Re: The houseplant and the goons
ygData.msgSnippet: I can live with that, Devilcat says.  Computer, deactivate force- field.  The shield vanishes without a trace.  Got to love alien technology.  Now, as for

"I can live with that," Devilcat says.  "Computer, deactivate force-
field."  The shield vanishes without a trace.  "Got to love alien 
technology.  Now, as for these Tripredacus forces, our sensor logs 
show that the existing group on this planet - what's left of it 
anyway - has joined up with the new contingent.  Judging by the size 
and classification of the ship and what I know about the first group, 
I estimate their combined forces to be somewhere between 8 and 20 
individuals - at least some of which will be elite warriors."

--- In nbwrpg@y..., "Nic" <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> Yggdrasil: That could be. I haven't seen what they brought here, but
> if it's big, it can mean they've got either a lot of resources or 
they
> brought all they had.
> 
> He picked up a loose bolt from a compartment in his arm and threw it
> at the forcefield.
> 
> Yggdrasil: By the way, keeping a prisoner is generally considered an
> act of war. I don't mind staying a little more to find out what
> happens with the Tripreds, but getting this forcefield off is a 
least.
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@y..., "cardhead649" <cardhead649@y...> wrote:
> > Devilcat scratches his chin.  "It would seem to me that whatever 
> > ruckus is happening, the Tripred forces are getting the better of 
it -
> >  otherwise why would they spare a ship and crew to this 
dirtball?  If 
> > that is the case, it puts the Rogues and the Maximals on the same 
> > side of the battlefield, temporarily at least."
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@y..., "Nic" <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > > Yggdrasil nodded. That was a resonnable offer and Devilcat 
seemed
> > > inclined to negotiate with him.
> > > 
> > > Yggdrasil: I can't tell much of what was directly happening on
> > > Cybertron because I was stationed on a backwater world before 
coming
> > > here. However, they sent me here to fetch Talos. As Talos is a 
great
> > > leader of men, I assume they needed him for either a large-scale
> > > operation or a military planning. Either way, I believe the so-
> > called
> > > Tripredacus are some important military guys, and I think they 
could
> > > be aiming for Cybertron. What they're here for, though... Could 
be
> > > they're seeking the Ark or the Nemesis, but your bet's as good 
as
> > > mine. I don't really know about them except as rumors as an
> > > underground organization, but I don't think the Preds are with 
them,
> > > at least not in practice.
> > > 
> > > --- In nbwrpg@y..., "cardhead649" <cardhead649@y...> wrote:
> > > > "It's not wise to make demands of someone who could kill you 
out 
> > of 
> > > > hand," Devilcat warns.  "But in any event, I'm prepared to 
return 
> > you 
> > > > to your Maximal brethren - IF you can help us in dealing with 
> > these 
> > > > Tripredacus buffoons.  Now, what was the status of Cybertron 
as 
> > you 
> > > > left it?"
> > > > 
> > > > --- In nbwrpg@y..., "Nic" <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > > > > If Yggdrasil Prime had had a mouth, he would have made a 
very 
> > > > > sarcastic smile right now.
> > > > > 
> > > > > Yggdrasil: Ah! So you want my help? I don't mind giving my 
> > advice, 
> > > > but 
> > > > > I do have a price, you know... It is not a very costly one, 
> > rest 
> > > > > assured, but you will have to give if you wish to receive...
> > > > > 
> > > > > --- In nbwrpg@y..., "cardhead649" <cardhead649@y...> wrote:
> > > > > > Jayde returns after a few moments, with Devilcat.  The 
leader 
> > of 
> > > > the 
> > > > > > Rogues doesn't beat around the bush:  "There's been a 
rather 
> > > > > > unexpected development.  Our sensor records tell us that 
a 
> > second 
> > > > > > wave of Tripredacus forces have arrived on this planet.  
In 
> > our 
> > > > > > opinion, this is trouble.  You have a more recent idea of 
the 
> > > > > > situation on Cybertron than us.  What are your thoughts?"
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > --- In nbwrpg@y..., "Nic" <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > > > > > > Yggdrasil doesn't acknowledge Jayde's departure. He 
just 
> > goes 
> > > > on 
> > > > > > > thinking about how a band of rebel maximals could go so 
low 
> > as 
> > > > to 
> > > > > > go 
> > > > > > > against all their teachings.
> > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > Yggdrasil: And with Pumpskin now in predacon hands... 
> > Primus 
> > > > help 
> > > > > > > me...
